poem:
**A New Taste**

In the kitchen's heart,  
Sandra stirs tradition's pot,  
seeking balance between love  
and a new, cautious recipe.  
She whispers to Kelvin  
through the steam,  
a promise of flavors  
both familiar and kind,  
an embrace on the plate  
as vibrant spices  
dance with health in mind.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "New scheme offers diabetes-friendly twists on African-Caribbean meals When Sandra Tomlinson’s husband, Kelvin, was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes, she set about figuring out how to cook healthier Caribbean meals without compromising on taste. Although she was offered education sessions on how to alter recipes to help him, she was concerned that serving them may lead to marital strife. The south Londoner says: “What they we were asking me to feed my husband would bring". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
